â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ lib/
â”‚   â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ spotify.ts
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   | --- FILE CONTENT START (spotify.ts) ---
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   | const client_id = process.env.SPOTIFY_CLIENT_ID;
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   | const client_secret = process.env.SPOTIFY_CLIENT_SECRET;
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   | const basic = Buffer.from(`${client_id}:${client_secret}`).toString('base64');
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   | 
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   | 
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   | const TOKEN_ENDPOINT = `https://accounts.spotify.com/api/token`;
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   | 
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   | export async function getAccessToken() {
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   |   // 1. Debug: Check if keys exist (Do not log the actual secret!)
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   |   console.log("ğŸ”‘ [Spotify] Checking credentials...");
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   |   if (!client_id) console.error("âŒ [Spotify] Missing SPOTIFY_CLIENT_ID");
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   |   if (!client_secret) console.error("âŒ [Spotify] Missing SPOTIFY_CLIENT_SECRET");
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   | 
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   |   const response = await fetch(TOKEN_ENDPOINT, {
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   |     method: 'POST',
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   |     headers: {
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   |       Authorization: `Basic ${basic}`,
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   |       'Content-Type': 'application/x-www-form-urlencoded',
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   |     },
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   |     body: 'grant_type=client_credentials',
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   |     cache: 'no-store', // Disable cache while debugging
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   |   });
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   | 
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   |   // 2. Debug: Check if token request worked
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   |   if (!response.ok) {
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   |     console.error(`âŒ [Spotify] Token Error: ${response.status} ${response.statusText}`);
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   |     const text = await response.text();
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   |     console.error("   Details:", text);
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   |     return {};
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   |   }
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   | 
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   |   const data = await response.json();
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   |   console.log("âœ… [Spotify] Access Token received");
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   |   return data;
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   | }
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   | 
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   | export async function getPlaylist(playlistId: string) {
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   |   const { access_token } = await getAccessToken();
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   | 
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   |   if (!access_token) {
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   |     console.error("âŒ [Spotify] No access token available. Cannot fetch playlist.");
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   |     return { error: { message: "No access token" } };
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   |   }
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   | 
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   |   console.log(`ğŸµ [Spotify] Fetching playlist: ${playlistId}...`);
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   | 
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   |   const response = await fetch(`https://api.spotify.com/v1/playlists/${playlistId}`, {
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   |     headers: {
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   |       Authorization: `Bearer ${access_token}`,
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   |     },
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   |     cache: 'no-store', // Disable cache while debugging
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   |   });
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   | 
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   |   // 3. Debug: Check if playlist request worked
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   |   if (!response.ok) {
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   |     console.error(`âŒ [Spotify] Playlist Fetch Failed: ${response.status}`);
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   |     const text = await response.text();
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   |     console.error("   Details:", text);
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   |     // Return a structured error so the UI handles it gracefully
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   |     return { error: { message: `Failed to fetch: ${response.statusText}` } };
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   |   }
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   | 
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   |   const data = await response.json();
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   |   console.log(`âœ… [Spotify] Successfully fetched playlist: "${data.name}"`);
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   |   
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   |   return data;
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   | }
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   | --- FILE CONTENT END ---

â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ search/
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ route.ts
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   | --- FILE CONTENT START (route.ts) ---
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   | import { NextResponse } from 'next/server';
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   | 
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   | export async function GET(request: Request) {
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   |   const { searchParams } = new URL(request.url);
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   |   const query = searchParams.get('q');
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   |   const API_KEY = process.env.YOUTUBE_API_KEY;
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   | 
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   |   if (!query) {
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   |     return NextResponse.json([]);
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   |   }
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   | 
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   |   try {
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   |     // 1. Try to extract Video ID from URL (handles watch, shorts, youtu.be)
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   |     const videoIdMatch = query.match(/(?:v=|shorts\/|youtu\.be\/|embed\/)([a-zA-Z0-9_-]{11})/);
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   |     
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   |     if (videoIdMatch && videoIdMatch[1]) {
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   |       const videoId = videoIdMatch[1];
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   |       const res = await fetch(
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   |         `https://www.googleapis.com/youtube/v3/videos?part=snippet&id=${videoId}&key=${API_KEY}`
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   |       );
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   |       const data = await res.json();
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   | 
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   |       if (data.items && data.items.length > 0) {
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   |         const item = data.items[0];
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   |         return NextResponse.json([{
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   |           id: item.id,
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   |           name: item.snippet.title,
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   |           artist: item.snippet.channelTitle,
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   |           image: item.snippet.thumbnails.medium?.url || item.snippet.thumbnails.default?.url,
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   |         }]);
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   |       }
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   |     }
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   | 
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   |     // 2. If no URL match, perform a Broad Search
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   |     const searchRes = await fetch(
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   |       `https://www.googleapis.com/youtube/v3/search?part=snippet&q=${encodeURIComponent(query)}&type=video&maxResults=5&key=${API_KEY}`
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   |     );
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   |     const searchData = await searchRes.json();
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   | 
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   |     // Log for debugging if search returns nothing
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   |     if (!searchData.items) {
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   |       console.log("YouTube API returned no items:", searchData);
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   |       return NextResponse.json([]);
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   |     }
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   | 
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   |     const results = searchData.items.map((item: any) => ({
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   |       id: item.id.videoId,
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   |       name: item.snippet.title,
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   |       artist: item.snippet.channelTitle,
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   |       image: item.snippet.thumbnails.medium?.url,
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   |     }));
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   | 
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   |     return NextResponse.json(results);
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   | 
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   |   } catch (error) {
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   |     console.error("YT API Error:", error);
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   |     return NextResponse.json({ error: 'YouTube search failed' }, { status: 500 });
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   |   }
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   | }
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   | --- FILE CONTENT END ---

â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ og/
â”‚   â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ route.tsx
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   | --- FILE CONTENT START (route.tsx) ---
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   | import { ImageResponse } from 'next/og'
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   | 
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   | // IMPORTANT: Define the runtime as 'edge' for this API to work correctly.
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   | export const runtime = 'edge'
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   | 
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   | // The URL for the Cloudinary background image
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   | const HERO_IMAGE_URL = 'https://res.cloudinary.com/dpmkshcky/image/upload/c_fill,g_auto,h_250,w_970/b_rgb:000000,e_gradient_fade,y_-0.50/c_scale,co_rgb:ffffff,fl_relative,l_text:montserrat_25_style_light_align_center:Your%20Funky%20Jazz,w_0.2,y_0.3/v1570237649/17160429878_68460aeb25_o-1_udg7bx.jpg'
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   | 
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   | // The GET function MUST be async to use fetch
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   | export async function GET(request: Request) {
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   |   let url = new URL(request.url)
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   |   let title = url.searchParams.get('title') || 'My Musical Journey, Jazz is everywhere'
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   | 
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   |   // --- 1. Fetch the External Image ---
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   |   let imageBuffer: ArrayBuffer | undefined;
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   |   try {
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   |       // Use fetch to get the image data
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   |       const response = await fetch(HERO_IMAGE_URL);
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   |       if (response.ok) {
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   |           imageBuffer = await response.arrayBuffer();
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   |       } else {
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   |           console.error(`Failed to fetch background image: ${response.status}`);
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   |       }
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   |   } catch (error) {
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   |       console.error('Error fetching image:', error);
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   |   }
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   | 
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   |   // --- 2. Render the ImageResponse with the image data ---
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   |   return new ImageResponse(
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   |     (
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   |       <div 
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   |         tw="flex flex-col w-full h-full items-center justify-center text-white"
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   |         style={{
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   |           // Fallback background color if image fails to load
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   |           backgroundColor: '#000', 
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   |         }}
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   |       >
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   |         {/* Render the Image element using the fetched URL */}
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   |         {imageBuffer ? (
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   |             // Use the <img> tag and the full URL
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   |             <img 
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   |                 src={HERO_IMAGE_URL} 
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   |                 alt="Arman Ayva Background" 
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   |                 width={1200}
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   |                 height={630}
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   |                 tw="absolute inset-0 w-full h-full object-cover" 
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   |             />
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   |         ) : (
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   |              // Simple fallback text if the image fails to load
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   |             <div tw="text-4xl">Image Failed to Load</div>
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   |         )}
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   |         
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   |         {/* Black Overlay for Readability */}
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   |         <div tw="absolute inset-0 bg-black opacity-60" />
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   |         
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   |         {/* Content container - place it on top of the overlay */}
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   |         <div tw="relative flex flex-col w-full p-16 justify-center items-center">
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   |           <h1 tw="text-6xl font-bold tracking-tight text-center max-w-4xl">
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   |             {title}
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   |           </h1>
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   |           <p tw="text-2xl mt-4">Arman Ayva | Composer & Musician</p>
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   |         </div>
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   |       </div>
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   |     ),
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   |     {
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   |       width: 1200,
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   |       height: 630,

â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   |         Arman Ayva â€“ Montreal Jazz Composer & Hobbyist ğŸ·
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   |       </h1>
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   |       
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   |       <div className="prose prose-neutral dark:prose-invert max-w-none">
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   |         <p className="lead text-xl">
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   |           Where modern jazz meets cinematic storytelling. Arman Ayva is a Montreal-based 
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   |           composer whose sound merges the soul of classic jazz with the 
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   |           freedom of funk and the mysticism of world music. 
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   |         </p>
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   | 
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   |         <hr className="my-8 border-neutral-200 dark:border-neutral-800" />
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   |         
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   |         {/* From Lens to Loops */}
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   |         <h2>From Lens to Loops: A Storyboard of Sound</h2>
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   |         <p>
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   |           Before I began composing jazz, my world was framed through a camera lens. As a 
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   |           <strong> photographer and amateur filmmaker</strong>, I spent years capturing visual 
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   |           stories. Today, I use those same visual instincts to storyboard with sound. I view 
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   |           my compositions as "invisible films," where every funky bass groove or mysterious 
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   |           piano line serves as a camera shot, and every melody develops a cinematic plot.
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   |         </p>
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   | 
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   |         {/* The Montreal Fusion */}
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   |         <h2>The Montreal Fusion: Armenian Soul meets Jazz-Funk</h2>
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   |         <p>
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   |           Based in the creative crossroads of Montreal, my music is a deeply personal exploration 
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   |           of heritage and rhythm. I bridge the warmth of <strong>Armenian folk motifs</strong> with 
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   |           the high-energy freedom of 1970s fusion and analog synth textures. Drawing inspiration 
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   |           from luminaries like <strong>Marcus Miller, US3, and Dave Brubeck</strong>, I craft 
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   |           compositions that feel both timeless and contemporary.
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   |         </p>
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   | 
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   |         {/* A Studio-First Hobbyist */}
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   |         <h3>A Studio-First Philosophy</h3>
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   |         <p>
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   |           I am not a performing artist; I am a studio-focused hobbyist dedicated to the 
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   |           architecture of sound. By focusing exclusively on production within 
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   |           <strong> Apple Logic Pro</strong>, I prioritize the intricate layering of live bass 
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   |           and global percussion. Whether it is the narrative-driven tracks of 
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   |           <em> Criminal Case N68</em> or the soulful improvisations of <em>Happy Bundle</em>, 
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   |           my music is an invitation to traverse new sound realms together.
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   |         </p>
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   | 
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   |         {/* Tastemaker Section */}
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   |         <h2>Beyond Composing: Curating the Vibe</h2>
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   |         <p>
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   |           Creation is only half the journey. As the curator of the 
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   |           <strong> "Funky Jazz Mood Lifter"</strong> playlist on Spotify, I connect with 
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   |           over hundreds of followers who share a passion for bass-heavy, mood-lifting instrumental 
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   |           grooves. It is a space where I celebrate the legends of the genre alongside 
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   |           the best new independent jazz-funk voices.
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   |         </p>
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   | 
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   |          Funky-Jazz-Mood-Lifter â†’
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   | 
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   |         
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   |         
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   |         <div className="rounded-xl overflow-hidden shadow-2xl">
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   |           <iframe 
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   |               style={{ borderRadius: '12px' }}

â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   | function slugify(str: string) {
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   |   return str
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   |     .toString()
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   |     .toLowerCase()
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   |     .trim()
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   |     .replace(/\s+/g, '-')
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   |     .replace(/&/g, '-and-')
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   |     .replace(/[^\w\-]+/g, '')
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   |     .replace(/\-\-+/g, '-')
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   | }
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   | 
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   | function createHeading(level: number) {

â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   | function parseFrontmatter(fileContent: string) {
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   |   let frontmatterRegex = /---\s*([\s\S]*?)\s*---/
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   |   let match = frontmatterRegex.exec(fileContent)
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   |   
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   |   if (!match) {
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   |     return { metadata: {} as Metadata, content: fileContent }
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   |   }
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   | 
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   |   let frontMatterBlock = match[1]
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   |   let content = fileContent.replace(frontmatterRegex, '').trim()
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   |   let frontMatterLines = frontMatterBlock.trim().split('\n')
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   |   let metadata: Partial<Metadata> = {}
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   | 
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   |   frontMatterLines.forEach((line) => {
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   |     // Improved split to handle values containing colons (like URLs)
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   |     let firstColonIndex = line.indexOf(':')
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   |     if (firstColonIndex > -1) {
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   |       let key = line.slice(0, firstColonIndex).trim()
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   |       let value = line.slice(firstColonIndex + 1).trim()
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   |       value = value.replace(/^['"](.*)['"]$/, '$1') // Remove quotes
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   |       metadata[key as keyof Metadata] = value
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   |     }
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   |   })
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   | 
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   |   return { metadata: metadata as Metadata, content }
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   | }
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   | 
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   | function getMDXFiles(dir: string) {
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   |   if (!fs.existsSync(dir)) {
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   |     console.warn(`Directory not found: ${dir}`);
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   |     return [];
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   |   }
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   |   return fs.readdirSync(dir).filter((file) => path.extname(file) === '.mdx')
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   | }
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   | 
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   | function readMDXFile(filePath: string) {
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   |   let rawContent = fs.readFileSync(filePath, 'utf-8')
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   |   return parseFrontmatter(rawContent)
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   | }
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   | 
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   | function getMDXData(dir: string) {
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   |   let mdxFiles = getMDXFiles(dir)
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   |   return mdxFiles.map((file) => {
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   |     let { metadata, content } = readMDXFile(path.join(dir, file))
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   |     // Use the filename as the slug
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   |     const slug = path.parse(file).name 
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   |       .toLowerCase()
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   |       .replace(/\s+/g, '-')
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   |       .replace(/_/g, '-')
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   |       .replace(/[^\w\-]+/g, '')
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   |     
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   |     return {
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   |       metadata,
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   |       slug,
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   |       content,
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   |     }
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   |   })
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   | }

â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   | 
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   | export function formatDate(date: string | null | undefined, includeRelative = false) {
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   |   if (!date) return 'Date TBD' 
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   | 
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   |   let currentDate = new Date()
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   |   // Ensure ISO format for parsing
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   |   let dateString = date.includes('T') ? date : `${date}T00:00:00`
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   |   let targetDate = new Date(dateString)
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   | 
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   |   // Calculate differences
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   |   let fullDate = targetDate.toLocaleString('en-us', {
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   |     month: 'long',
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   |     day: 'numeric',
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   |     year: 'numeric',
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   |   })
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   | 
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   |   if (!includeRelative) return fullDate
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   | 
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   |   const diffInMs = currentDate.getTime() - targetDate.getTime();
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   |   const diffInDays = Math.floor(diffInMs / (1000 * 60 * 60 * 24));
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   |   
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   |   let relative = '';
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   |   if (diffInDays < 1) relative = 'Today';
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   |   else if (diffInDays < 30) relative = `${diffInDays}d ago`;
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   |   else if (diffInDays < 365) relative = `${Math.floor(diffInDays / 30)}mo ago`;
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   |   else relative = `${Math.floor(diffInDays / 365)}y ago`;
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   | 
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   |   return `${fullDate} (${relative})`
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   | } 
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   | 
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   | 
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   | export function getBlogPosts(lang: string) {
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   |   const targetLang = lang || 'en';
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   | 
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   |   // FIX: Based on your log, 'posts' is INSIDE 'blog'.
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   |   // We need to look into: app/[lang]/blog/posts
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   |   // Then we find the specific language folder inside 'posts'.
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   |   const postsPath = path.join(
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   |     process.cwd(),
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   |     'app',
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   |     '[lang]',
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   |     'blog',
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   |     'posts',
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   |     targetLang
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   |   );
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   | 
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   |   if (!fs.existsSync(postsPath)) {
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   |     // FALLBACK: If you didn't create subfolders for each language yet,
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   |     // and your .mdx files are just sitting inside 'posts' directly:
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   |     const flatPath = path.join(process.cwd(), 'app', '[lang]', 'blog', 'posts');
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   |     
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   |     if (fs.existsSync(flatPath)) {
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   |       console.log(`Found posts in flat structure: ${flatPath}`);
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   |       return getMDXData(flatPath);
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   |     }
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   | 
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   |     console.error(`âŒ MDX directory not found at: ${postsPath}`);
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   |     return [];
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   |   }
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   | 
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   |   return getMDXData(postsPath);
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   | }
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   | --- FILE CONTENT END ---

â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   | --- FILE CONTENT START (page.tsx) ---
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   | import Link from 'next/link'
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   | import { formatDate, getBlogPosts } from 'app/[lang]/blog/utils'
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   | 
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   | // 1. Make the function async
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   | import { BlogPosts as BlogPostsList } from 'app/components/posts';
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   | 
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   | interface BlogPostsListProps {
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   |   lang: string;

â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   | export function BlogPosts({ lang }: { lang: string }) {

â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   |   let allBlogs = getBlogPosts(lang)

â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   |           if (new Date(a.metadata.publishedAt) > new Date(b.metadata.publishedAt)) {
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   |             return -1
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   |           }
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   |           return 1
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   |         })
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   |         .map((post) => (

â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   |           >

â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   |                 {formatDate(post.metadata.publishedAt, false)}
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   |               </p>

â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   |         </p>

â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   |           digital audio tools. 
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   |         </p>

â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   |           Some compositions may include sounds, loops, or samples that come pre-installed within Logic Proâ€™s 
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   |           software library.
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   |         </p>
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   |         
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   |         <h2>Royalty-Free Usage (Apple Logic Pro)</h2>
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   |         <p>
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   |           According to **Apple Inc.â€™s Logic Pro Software License Agreement (Section C â€“ Sample Content)**, 
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   |           all Apple-provided loops and samples are **royalty-free** for use in original compositions and 
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   |           can be **distributed, broadcast, and monetized** as part of a complete musical or audiovisual work.
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   |         </p>

â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   |           </p>
